website_summaries.verdict: A lightweight towel that has a softer and less "sticky" feel than other microfiber cooling towels.
pros: Wet, wring and use to keep cool
Feels better than other microfiber towels
Stays wet for a long period of time
cons: This towel can be washed in a machine, but must be air dried

customer_reviews.title: Wonderfully soft coooling towel!
customer_reviews.text: This is much softer than other cooling towel company's models, and seemsmore lighter on the neck as well. It is machine washable, and easy to store outside the container. It has been used steadily for a week now, as I have a condition where I need a cooling towel to be outside over 80 degrees. I would recommend in the summertime to place a few ice cubes in the neck area, this way, as the ice melt the towel stays cooler longer. Love the towel, Love the brand and could not be more pleased!
customer_reviews.author: Redz

customer_reviews.title: affinity arctic breeze cooling towel
customer_reviews.text: This cooling towel came well packaged in a special bottle. The actual towel size is 12'' x 32'' and the mesh fiber material is very soft. I found that after this cooling towel is soaked in cold water and wringed out, the cool stays for some time. According to the description though, you can't store or pack it while it's wet. This towel is also easy to care for, since it's machine washable (with warm water and mild detergent) though it's air-dry only, so no dryer. Overall, I'm pleased with this towel.
customer_reviews.author: Alla S.

customer_reviews.title: Light weight but holds the water and cools me down in hot weather.
customer_reviews.text: I love these cooling towels. Although one could use a bandana soaked in water, these towels absorb more water and stay wet longer. A life saver in hot weather. Can’t wait to take it on vacation wirh me soon. It’s very light weight, easy to take along. You can even just tie it to your carry-on. That way you are immediately ready for that tropical destination. Best thing is that it dries fast.
customer_reviews.author: Ursula

customer_reviews.title: Effective Workout Gear
customer_reviews.text: I do one-hour kettlebell workouts 4 days a week in my garage in Southern California. Even with the fan on, I sweat a lot. I like that I can soak the Arctic Breeze cooling towel in cold water, wring it, then put it over my head. It stays in place pretty well. Or I can tie it loosely around my neck. On other days, I simply use it to wipe sweat from my face. You can wash this in a warm-water setting with gentle detergent, but you must air-dry this. You cannot put it in the dryer or you will compromise its longevity. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: M. JEFFREY MCMAHON

customer_reviews.title: keeping it cool
customer_reviews.text: I get hot really easy. I don't like hot weather. I live where there's hot weather. Such is life. A little relief makes all the difference on my head, and that's where this cooling towel comes in. Offers a more sustained cooling than just pouring water on my head, with a lot less mess too. A great extra little comfort that can add zip to a hike or recovery to a rest.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick O

customer_reviews.title: Refreshing
customer_reviews.text: These cooling towels are really neat. This one comes with a pretty good case, too. It's not much better than less expensive versions, though.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Silverman

customer_reviews.title: Easy Evaporative Cooling
customer_reviews.text: Easy Evaporative Cooling Wet it, Wring it, Wrap It around your neck for cooling without the soggy, drippy cloth. It comes in different colors with the technology for evaporative cooling. There's a lot to like here ... easy, cute, effective!
customer_reviews.author: Lynrie

customer_reviews.title: Great little cooling towel
customer_reviews.text: I've always liked these cooling towels. You make'em wet and they act as a nice little chiller. While it won't make you suddenly no longer need AC in the Texas heat, it is a nice comfort.
customer_reviews.author: Storm the Penguin

customer_reviews.title: Every runner needs this
customer_reviews.text: works like a charm. Believe it or not it was 71 degrees today! Weird I know for the second week in January. I'm not complaining though. It gave me a chance to try this and it worked great at keeping me cool. I wet it at the beginning of my run, and 11 miles later it still did the trick.
customer_reviews.author: imsocrazy

customer_reviews.title: good product
customer_reviews.text: My husband is a runner and now that warm weather is here, he takes a cooling towel out with him everyday. He likes this one and finds it helpful and refreshing.
customer_reviews.author: T. Gaston

customer_reviews.title: Cold Touch?
customer_reviews.text: This towel doesn't actually cool you as much as it says it does.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Kerner
